summary: This bill, the World War II Women's Memorial Location Act, aims to authorize the location of a memorial commemorating the contributions of women who worked on the U.S. home front during World War II. It specifically allows the memorial to be situated on the National Mall, referencing previous legislation (the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023) that authorized the memorial's creation. The bill acknowledges the significant contributions of these women in various roles supporting the war effort.
